title: London Bridges - Southwark to Lambeth
description:
A leisurely stroll along the banks of the River Thames starting in the ancient City of London and passing through the historic city of Westminster. We will be crossing several of London's iconic bridges including the Millennium Footbridge and Westminster Bridge.

Optional: Please join us in the pub near the end of the walk for a drink and a chat.

Leader: James A
Start time: 7pm
Start Point: Cannon Street station (zone 1)
Finish Point: Vauxhall station (zone 1 and 2)
Distance: 4.0 miles 6.5 km
Terrain: Urban riverside
Grading: Leisurely

This walk is also listed in the Ramblers Association Walks Finder
[https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4182741](https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4182741)

title: Gordon Hill to Walthamstow (17 miles/Moderate)
description:
**Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/)**

We leave London behind us taking in the New River before reaching historic Waltham Abbey for lunch. We cross the M25 a second time as we return to the capital via Epping Forest, a royal hunting lodge and on to Walthamstow. Pub at the end, bring a packed lunch.

* Terrain: Fields, woods, rivers
* Grading: Moderate. For an explanation of the gradings, please see https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks/faq/ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
* Travel: Take the 10:13 from Moorgate (10:27 Finsbury Park), arr Gordon Hill 10:50. Use Oyster/contactless.
* Finish Point: Walthamstow Central station (zone 3)
* More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4183218

title: A happy walk filled with riddles (11 miles/Moderate)
description:
**Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/)**

We will walk from Happy Valley toward Riddlesdown, visiting some section of North Downs, an aerodrome, an observatory and a few nice commons in the process.

* Terrain: Commons and Hills
* Grading: Moderate. For an explanation of the gradings, please see https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks/faq/ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
* Travel: Take 10:25 from London Bridge train arr. Purley 10:47, or 10:05 from London Vistoria (10:12 Clapham Junction), arr Purley 10:27. Use Oyster/contactless.
* Finish Point: Coulsdon South station (zone 6)
* More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4183217

title: The Alternative Italy to Switzerland
description:
Ever wished you could walk from the canals in Venice to a cottage in Switzerland without leaving London?

Well now you can on this walk from Little Venice to Swiss Cottage. We will also be walking past the home of English cricket and across the famous zebra crossing at Abbey Road, something you wouldn't be able to do if you flew out to Italy.

Please meet at the Hammersmith & City exit by the canal. If arriving on another line please allow plenty of time to get to this part of the station for a prompt start.

Optional: Please join us in the pub near the end of the walk for a drink and a chat.

Leader: Phil B
Start time: 7pm
Start Point: Paddington station (zone 1)
Finish Point: Swiss Cottage tube (zone 2)
Distance: 3.0 miles 4.8 km
Terrain: Urban
Grading: Leisurely

title: Hertfordshire Way: Royston to Buntingford (15 miles/Moderate)
description:
**Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/)**

Whilst this is the final section of the Hertfordshire Way, this is not the final Hertfordshire Way walk! From Royston, we take a sweeping arc to the south-east passing through many north Herts villages such as Reed, Barkway, Nuthampstead and Hare Street before finishing in the small market town of Buntingford. Please bring a packed lunch. Refreshments possible en route.

* Terrain: Fields, woods
* Grading: Moderate. For an explanation of the gradings, please see https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks/faq/ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
* Travel: Take 9:31 from London St Pancras International (9:16 London Bridge, 9:22 Blackfriars, 9:42 Finsbury Park) arr. Royston 10:24. Buy return to Royston. The walk ends in the town of Buntingford. Buses returning go to either Royston or Baldock/Stevenage (both 2hrly) or Hertford (hrly).
* Alternatively take the 09:28 from London Kings Cross (09:33 Finsbury Park) arrive Royston 10:32
* Finish Point: Buntingford (bus to return)
* More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4181990

group.name: Metropolitan Walkers - walks in London and the South East

title: Harpenden to St Albans (19 miles/Strenuous)
description:
**Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/)**

This walk takes in Hartfordshire rolling hills, to finish off in Cathedral in St Albans. This walk will be held at a fast pace. Bring a packed lunch.

* Terrain: Rolling hills
* Grading: Strenuous. For an explanation of the gradings, please see https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks/faq/ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
* Travel: Take 9:36 from London St Pancrsas International (9:21 London Bridge, 9:26 Blackfriars, 9:31 Farringdon) arr. Harpenden 10.01. Buy return to Harpenden.

* More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4182857

group.name: Metropolitan Walkers - walks in London and the South East

title: Full moon night walk: Branscombe and the Undercliffs (15 miles/Strenuous)
description:
**THIS WALK IS LIMITED TO 30 PARTICIPANTS - Please book via this event.**
**Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/)**

This is a coastal epic, taking in a brilliant piece of the South West Coast Path! If you take travel option 1 or 2, there will also be a chance for canoeing at Exeter Quay, and with options 1,2 or 3 a visit to Exeter Cathedral, a Devon cream tea, and a swim or paddle in the sea. We'll take a bus from Exeter to near the Mason's Arms (2.5mile walk). As we'll be on a night walk, eating a meal at the Mason's Arms is strongly recommended. Feel free to drink as you see fit!
We'll head off from the Mason's Arms at about 11pm, heading down to Branscombe mouth, before joining the coast path. We'll have a break at the beach in the village of Beer, where we can go paddling, and again in Seaton. We'll then head along the Undercliffs (a National Nature Reserve) to Lyme Regis. There'll be an opportunity to go fossil hunting at Lyme Regis. Remember a torch, snacks, water, warm clothes, a camera if you have one, and a big smile and spirit of adventure!
Please email the walk leader on thurstonrichard@hotmail.com by the day before - and preferably by 3 September - to say you'll be coming - so space can be booked for you in the pub - and whether you are meeting us at Exeter St Davids, Exeter Central or at the pub.

* Terrain: Coastal, hilly
* Grading: Strenuous. For an explanation of the gradings, please see https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks/faq/ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
* Travel: You have choices regarding when to arrive. Each of the following are fine.
* Option 1: Travel to Exeter on the Friday, and stay overnight. Buy a return to Exeter St Davids. Meet at Exeter St Davids at 09:20 on Saturday.
* Option 2: Take the 07:00 from Paddington to Exeter St Davids on the Saturday morning, arriving 09:17. Buy a return to Exeter St Davids and meet there.
* Option 3: Meet us at 12:40 at Exeter Central. Various train options are available. Buy a return to Exeter St Davids.
* Option 4: Meet us at the Mason's Arms, Branscombe EX12 3DJ at 19:30. This is feasible by public transport, but you'll need to be comfortable with your own wayfinding to get you there.
* Return travel is from Lyme Regis (08:23 bus to Axminster on Sunday morning), and then from Axminster the 09:07 train to London Waterloo (options also available to London Paddington).
* Advance rail tickets already available.
* Finish Point: Axminster station
* More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4183220

group.name: Metropolitan Walkers - walks in London and the South East

title: Wimbledon architecture walk - Open House London (4 miles/Leisurely)
description:
**Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info at [https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/](https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/how-to-join/)**

This circular walk will take in some of the greater and lesser known, and very varied and interesting buildings of Wimbledon, with a partly-new route compared with 2021. This walk forms part of the Open House London 2022 festival, and includes information on selected buildings of interest. On completion of the walk, you're welcome to join us for a drink. Finish time for the walk is approximately 6pm.

* Terrain: Urban
* Grading: Leisurely. For an explanation of the gradings, please see https://www.metropolitan-walkers.org.uk/walks/faq/ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
* Travel: Please use TfL Journey Planner to arrive on time.
* Finish Point: Wimbledon station (zone 3)
* More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/find-a-walk-or-route/walk-detail.aspx?walkID=4181991

group.name: Metropolitan Walkers - walks in London and the South East

title: Blues Kitchen - Camden London NW1
description:
Come join me at Blues Kitchen - Restaurant, bar & club hosting the best barbeque, burgers and cocktails as well as live blues, soul & funk, with live music until late every night.
See the picture of some of the food that is available there.
[Blues Kitchen](https://theblueskitchen.com/camden/)
Nearst Tube Station in Mornington Crescent.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Crome London - French Toast Cafe
description:
Come and join me for a late brunch at Crome London for some wonderful french toast and other treats.
Introducing London's first French toast café, harnessing our craftsmanship and expert knowledge in food science and speciality coffee to bring you a new food and drink concept.
[Crome London](https://www.cromelondon.com/)
Our French toast stacks are well known twists on your favourite brunch classics – finished with sweet or savoury toppings inspired by the food and drink trends of the future.
Enjoy our fresh new addition to London's dining scene and be in your element.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Seven Dials Market - Cucumber Alley & Banana Warehouse
description:
There are some many wonderful places to eat all under one roof. Take a look at the pictures.
EXPRESS - Bringing real Indian street snacks to the West End. This is the food you eat when you need reassurance – for the soothing flavours of fresh chutneys, puffed rice and properly spiced chaat.
SOFT SERVE SOCIETY - Dreamy soft-serve ice cream served as standard cones, sundaes or freakshakes!
WHEELCAKE ISLAND - Wheelcakes are soft, moist, fluffy Taiwanese pancakes with creamy fillings in a variety of flavours including adzuki bean, chocolate, matcha and vanilla custard.
Pick & Cheese - The world’s first cheese conveyor belt has not come to play. 40m of rotating rounds of expertly chosen cheese pairings swerve by like they own the joint. They do really – they’re glorious. Come prepared to feast in the most delightful way possible.
OSHPAZ DUMPLINGS - Central Asian Cuisine.
ONG ONG BUNS - Serving up the finest Asian baked goods.
BOOLAY CREPES - Crème brûlée crêpe cones.
Club Mexicana - Cheezeburger tacos, annato glazed ‘short rib’ burritos, loaded nachos and vegan wine, beer and frozen Margaritas.
TRUFFLE BURGER - This is the winner for me.
SHUK - Tel Aviv street food
Bong Bongs - Classic Filipino food.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Saffron Kitchen - Indian Fusion Dishes
description:
Saffron Kitchen is one of my favorite places to eat. Creative fusion dishes and Mumbai-style street food in a sleek Indian restaurant.

Saffron Kitchen is dedicated to providing natural, fresh and outstanding quality food that intrigues and delights your palate.

Address - 300 Lea Bridge Rd, London E10 7LD

£5 payment to prevent no shows and will go towards fee paid to run the group.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Blues Kitchen - Camden London NW1
description:
Come join me at Blues Kitchen - Restaurant, bar & club hosting the best barbeque, burgers and cocktails as well as live blues, soul & funk, with live music until late every night. You will get £5 back either toward a drink or returned by Paypal as long as you attend.
[Blues Kitchen](https://theblueskitchen.com/camden/)
Nearest Tube Station in Mornington Crescent.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Kibele Restaurant  - Turkish Food
description:
When you visit Kibele, you enter the multidimensional world of tastes and aromas of classical Turkish cuisine with a modern twist and focus on sensational seasonal ingredients from diverse Turkish regions.

[Kibele Restaurant](https://kibelerestaurant.co.uk/restaurant/)

Here you can find our menu composed of original dishes enriched with deluxe ingredients and exquiste spices from all over Turkey, which you can enjoy in a cosily arranged interior, from lunch special to group set menus, served with over 50 wines from around the world.

Accomodating for all tastes and dietary requirements, we offer vegeterian, vegan and gluten-free dishes.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Mango Tree - Thai restaurant - Victoria
description:
Come and eat with me at the Mango Tree in Victoria.
Mango Tree is an award-winning Thai restaurant in the heart of Belgravia, London, serving outstanding authentic Thai cuisine. The team at Mango Tree is committed to offering customers a wonderful dining experience with a taste of warm Thai hospitality. From corporate occasions to private parties, Mango Tree invites our customers to experience the very best of Bangkok. [Thai Food](https://www.mangotree.org.uk)

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Buster Mantis - Sunday Dinner -  Jamaican Style
description:
Come and join me for a sunday roast at Buster Mantis a bar in Deptford, south London.
They are located down a little alleyway just off Deptford High Street, spread over two railway arches underneath the platforms of Deptford rail station. One arch functions as a bar and eatery, with the other arch serving as a gallery and creative space, hosting regular events, art exhibitions and screenings.
Please have a look at the pictures this should be come really good food.
[Buster Mantis](https://www.bustermantis.com)

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Kimchee - Korean food
description:
Contemporary Korean restaurant is just a stone’s throw from King’s Cross and St. Pancras Stations, in Pancras Square.
Kimchee offers quality food and excellent service in a sleek and stylish interior, whilst maintaining a real sense of Korean authenticity.
Classic Korean flavours and dishes with a modern twist.
[Kimchee - Korean Food](https://kimchee.uk.com/)

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Ma Petite jamaica - Camden London NW1
description:
Come and join me for dinnner and dancing at Ma Petite for Authentic Jamaican food Located in the heart of Camden they also offer famous rum cocktails as well as:-
Ackee & Saltfish, fried dumplings
Jerk Chicken
Chickpea and pumpkin curry
Curried goat with rice n peas
As well as many more dishes. Check out their [Menu](https://www.mapetitejamaica.com/menu)
They have a DJ on site so after dinner you can dance the evening away to some great music.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Sambal Shiok: Malaysian Food
description:
Come and eat some wonderful Malaysian Food - See menu and pictures.

[Menu](https://www.dropbox.com/s/hxq54huwgbl2zs5/sambal_shiok_menu.pdf?dl=0)

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group

title: Incognito Bar - kingston
description:
Join me in a world of pure imagination at the Incognito Bar in Kingston. This is not a cheap place but it does look magical.
£25.00 fee is because I had to put my credit card down to book £15 will go towards your drink.
Please be sure that you will attend before you RSVP - Have a look at the menu, prices and pictures to make sure it is a place that you would like to go to. They only allow 6 maximum per party.

group.name: London Food Fun and Travel Group
